daylight-text-climate-1: There is a low amount of daylight in the room, which makes the room suboptimal for most activities.
ventilation-text-climate-1: There will be a high chance of over heating and the room will be an unhealthy and uncomfortable place.
daylight-text-climate-2: There is a medium amount of daylight in the room, which makes the room suboptimal for some activities.
ventilation-text-climate-2: There will be a medium chance of over heating and the room will be a suboptimal place.
daylight-text-climate-3: There is a high amount of daylight in the room, which makes the room optimal for most activities.
ventilation-text-climate-3: There will be a low chance of over heating and the room will be a healthy and comfortable place.
daylight-text-climate-4: There is an adequate amount of daylight in the room, which makes the room optimal for all activities.
ventilation-text-climate-4: There will be low chance of over heating and the room will be a healthy and comfortable place.
daylight-text-climate-5: There is a very high amount of daylight in the room, which makes the room optimal for all activities.
ventilation-text-climate-5: There will be a very low chance of over heating and the room will be a healthy and comfortable place.
daylight-percentage-text-climate-1: Less light than in your current room
ventilation-percentage-text-climate-1: Slower to change air in your room
daylight-percentage-text-climate-2: Same amount of light as in your current room
ventilation-percentage-text-climate-2: Same air change time as in your current room
daylight-percentage-text-climate-3: More light than in your current room
ventilation-percentage-text-climate-3: Faster to change air in your room
ventilation-minutes-text-climate: Air renewal time is up to {} min
climate-imprint:
Both the daylight and natural ventilation score is a great help when checking how the VELUX design proposals affect a room's indoor climate. The higher the score, the better the room is fit for people, activity and life.

Based on the European standards for daylight and ventilation in buildings (EU 17037), the score is an aggregated total that reflects how well the room meets professional metrics for human wellbeing.
